Key Match Events: The game ended with a 104-100 win for the Miami Heat, a late 19-5 run by the Heat helped them escape from what was a seven-point deficit with 7 minutes left.

Amen Thompson threw Tyler Herro to the ground after they exchanged words, Rozier entered the fray immediately afterward and plenty of players from both teams engaged in some pushing, shoving and yelling.
Post-Match Reflections: Herro said he felt that frustrated Thompson.
Herro said he got a bruise near one of his hips from the fall to the ground, but he expects to play Wednesday against the Pelicans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Miami led by as much as 12 points midway through the third quarter.
Houston led by as much as 12 points midway through the third quarter.
Others: Seven ejections took place in the final minute of the game.
The suspensions will cause Amen Thompson to lose about $127,586 from his salary and Terry Rozier to lose about $143,242 in salary.
